name: df-pconn
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cpconn, crab(s0, ctop, wral(s1, cuni(cv(s0)), wral(s2, cuni(cv(s0)), wrex(s3, co(cii, ccn, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s3), nat0), cv(s1)), wceq(cfv(cv(s3), nat1), cv(s2))))))))
comment: Define the class of path-connected topologies. A topology is path-connected if there is a path (a continuous function from the closed unit interval) that goes from ` x ` to ` y ` for any points ` x , y ` in the space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Feb-2015.)
